title: Jose Enrique reflects on a tough 12 months after beating illness to play for Liverpool Legends
text:
Former Liverpool defender Jose Enrique has reflected emotionally on the most testing year of his life, which saw him battle a brain tumour before recovering in time to take back to the football pitch.

Enrique joined a host of fellow legends on Saturday in Glasgow's Ibrox stadium, as stars of yesteryear did battle for charity in a Rangers versus Liverpool clash.

The Spanish star was able to share the pitch once again with former team-mates including Steven Gerrard, Dirk Kuyt and Glen Johnson, and admitted afterwards the pride he had taken from doing so.

Jose Enrique (right) stepped out at Ibrox on Saturday as part of Liverpool legends' side

'A year ago I had a tumour in my head, I thought I was dying, and now I'm playing here in front of 30,000 people. I can be grateful and happy to be part of this,' Enrique told Liverpool's official website.

'It's amazing. It has been a very difficult time, probably the most difficult time of my life.

'To [wear] this shirt again, it's my club – I feel like this is my club – and to play 90 minutes again with this team is amazing.'

A £115m radiotherapy machine in Paris helped remove the cancerous cells in Enrique's brain

The surgery involved entering the brain through the nasal passages to remove the tumour

Enrique, now 33, showed off his superior fitness levels by playing 90minutes of the contest.

'There were a lot of goals, all in the first half. It was really good, I really enjoyed [playing] 90 minutes,' he added.

'I don't even remember the last time I played 90 minutes. I was really happy to see the guys and obviously to play again.

'When you are retired, to come here and play in front of the fans, you have memories and you enjoy it so much. I won't forget this.'
description: Former Liverpool defender Jose Enrique has reflected emotionally on the most testing year of his life, which saw him battle a brain tumour before recovering in time to take back to the football pitch.
